Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.
 
 This world in arms in not spending money alone.
 
 It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children.

 It is two electric power plants, each serving a town of 60,000 population. 
 
 It is two fine, fully equipped hospitals.
 
 It is some 50 miles of concrete highway.
 
 We pay for a single fighter with a half million bushels of wheat.
 
 We pay for a single destroyer with new homes that could have housed more than 8,000 people.
 
 This, I repeat, is the best way of life to be found on the road the world has been taking.
 
 This is not a way of life at all, in any true sense. Under the cloud of threatening war, it is humanity hanging from a cross of iron.

Like Obama's gift is his ability to inspire. He makes the previously invisible feel like they matter. He makes me want to do more, to better, for my country and fellow man. I have seen that impact in my neighborhood.
Maybe so but there is no Cheerleader in Chief. When it comes to making a tough decision the man is like a deer in headlights. He also cares too much about what others think. Give W. Bush some credit here...he never cared at all but others thought of him which is actually good for a leader (better than the opposite extreme). Worst of all, he doesn't have any ability to think in the abstract. By this I mean he can't hear something and go "does this make sense?". Instead he hears something from someone who is "respected" and assumes it to be true no questions asked. Thus we get things like the stimulus bill which we can all conclude was a failure on numerous levels. 
 
 But this thread is about Palin and frankly Palin is like my last point about Obama. Without that rare ability to have superior common sense you end up with a bad president. I'm sure Palin is a nice person and is smart and has some good ideas but she is not presidential material...but you know what, neither am I :)

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  2012: The Palin/Beck Ticket
